018package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter;
019
020import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
021import static org.junit.Assert.assertNotNull;
022import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
023
024import java.io.IOException;
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Arrays;
027import java.util.List;
028import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Cell;
029import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.CellComparatorImpl;
030import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.CompareOperator;
031import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseClassTestRule;
032import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility;
033import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HColumnDescriptor;
034import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HRegionInfo;
035import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HTableDescriptor;
036import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.KeyValue;
037import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TableName;
038import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Put;
039import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Scan;
040import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.filter.Filter.ReturnCode;
041import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion;
042import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.InternalScanner;
043import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.FilterTests;
044import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.testclassification.SmallTests;
045import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Bytes;
046import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.EnvironmentEdgeManager;
047import org.junit.After;
048import org.junit.Before;
049import org.junit.ClassRule;
050import org.junit.Test;
051import org.junit.experimental.categories.Category;
052import org.slf4j.Logger;
053import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
054
055@Category({ FilterTests.class, SmallTests.class })
056public class TestDependentColumnFilter {
057
058  @ClassRule
059  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
060    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestDependentColumnFilter.class);
061
062  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestDependentColumnFilter.class);
063  private static final byte[][] ROWS = { Bytes.toBytes("test1"), Bytes.toBytes("test2") };
064  private static final byte[][] FAMILIES =
065    { Bytes.toBytes("familyOne"), Bytes.toBytes("familyTwo") };
066  private static final long STAMP_BASE = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
067  private static final long[] STAMPS = { STAMP_BASE - 100, STAMP_BASE - 200, STAMP_BASE - 300 };
068  private static final byte[] QUALIFIER = Bytes.toBytes("qualifier");
069  private static final byte[][] BAD_VALS =
070    { Bytes.toBytes("bad1"), Bytes.toBytes("bad2"), Bytes.toBytes("bad3") };
071  private static final byte[] MATCH_VAL = Bytes.toBytes("match");
072  private final static HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility();
073
074  List<KeyValue> testVals;
075  private HRegion region;
076
077  @Before
078  public void setUp() throws Exception {
079    testVals = makeTestVals();
080
081    HTableDescriptor htd = new HTableDescriptor(TableName.valueOf(this.getClass().getSimpleName()));
082    HColumnDescriptor hcd0 = new HColumnDescriptor(FAMILIES[0]);
083    hcd0.setMaxVersions(3);
084    htd.addFamily(hcd0);
085    HColumnDescriptor hcd1 = new HColumnDescriptor(FAMILIES[1]);
086    hcd1.setMaxVersions(3);
087    htd.addFamily(hcd1);
088    HRegionInfo info = new HRegionInfo(htd.getTableName(), null, null, false);
089    this.region = HBaseTestingUtility.createRegionAndWAL(info, TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir(),
090      TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), htd);
091    addData();
092  }
093
094  @After
095  public void tearDown() throws Exception {
096    HBaseTestingUtility.closeRegionAndWAL(this.region);
097  }
098
099  private void addData() throws IOException {
100    Put put = new Put(ROWS[0]);
101    // add in an entry for each stamp, with 2 as a "good" value
102    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[0], BAD_VALS[0]);
103    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[1], BAD_VALS[1]);
104    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2], MATCH_VAL);
105    // add in entries for stamps 0 and 2.
106    // without a value check both will be "accepted"
107    // with one 2 will be accepted(since the corresponding ts entry
108    // has a matching value
109    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[0], BAD_VALS[0]);
110    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2], BAD_VALS[2]);
111
112    this.region.put(put);
113
114    put = new Put(ROWS[1]);
115    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[0], BAD_VALS[0]);
116    // there is no corresponding timestamp for this so it should never pass
117    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2], MATCH_VAL);
118    // if we reverse the qualifiers this one should pass
119    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[0], MATCH_VAL);
120    // should pass
121    put.addColumn(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[1], BAD_VALS[2]);
122
123    this.region.put(put);
124  }
125
126  private List<KeyValue> makeTestVals() {
127    List<KeyValue> testVals = new ArrayList<>();
128    testVals.add(new KeyValue(ROWS[0], FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[0], BAD_VALS[0]));
129    testVals.add(new KeyValue(ROWS[0], FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[1], BAD_VALS[1]));
130    testVals.add(new KeyValue(ROWS[0], FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[1], BAD_VALS[2]));
131    testVals.add(new KeyValue(ROWS[0], FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[0], MATCH_VAL));
132    testVals.add(new KeyValue(ROWS[0], FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2], BAD_VALS[2]));
133
134    return testVals;
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * This shouldn't be confused with TestFilter#verifyScan as expectedKeys is not the per row total,
139   * but the scan total
140   */
141  private void verifyScan(Scan s, long expectedRows, long expectedCells) throws IOException {
142    InternalScanner scanner = this.region.getScanner(s);
143    List<Cell> results = new ArrayList<>();
144    int i = 0;
145    int cells = 0;
146    for (boolean done = true; done; i++) {
147      done = scanner.next(results);
148      Arrays.sort(results.toArray(new Cell[results.size()]), CellComparatorImpl.COMPARATOR);
149      LOG.info("counter=" + i + ", " + results);
150      if (results.isEmpty()) break;
151      cells += results.size();
152      assertTrue("Scanned too many rows! Only expected " + expectedRows
153        + " total but already scanned " + (i + 1), expectedRows > i);
154      assertTrue("Expected " + expectedCells + " cells total but " + "already scanned " + cells,
155        expectedCells >= cells);
156      results.clear();
157    }
158    assertEquals("Expected " + expectedRows + " rows but scanned " + i + " rows", expectedRows, i);
159    assertEquals("Expected " + expectedCells + " cells but scanned " + cells + " cells",
160      expectedCells, cells);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Test scans using a DependentColumnFilter
165   */
166  @Test
167  public void testScans() throws Exception {
168    Filter filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER);
169
170    Scan scan = new Scan();
171    scan.setFilter(filter);
172    scan.setMaxVersions(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
173
174    verifyScan(scan, 2, 8);
175
176    // drop the filtering cells
177    filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, true);
178    scan = new Scan();
179    scan.setFilter(filter);
180    scan.setMaxVersions(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
181
182    verifyScan(scan, 2, 3);
183
184    // include a comparator operation
185    filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, false, CompareOperator.EQUAL,
186      new BinaryComparator(MATCH_VAL));
187    scan = new Scan();
188    scan.setFilter(filter);
189    scan.setMaxVersions(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
190
191    /*
192     * expecting to get the following 3 cells row 0 put.add(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2],
193     * MATCH_VAL); put.add(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2], BAD_VALS[2]); row 1
194     * put.add(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2], MATCH_VAL);
195     */
196    verifyScan(scan, 2, 3);
197
198    // include a comparator operation and drop comparator
199    filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, true, CompareOperator.EQUAL,
200      new BinaryComparator(MATCH_VAL));
201    scan = new Scan();
202    scan.setFilter(filter);
203    scan.setMaxVersions(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
204
205    /*
206     * expecting to get the following 1 cell row 0 put.add(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, STAMPS[2],
207     * BAD_VALS[2]);
208     */
209    verifyScan(scan, 1, 1);
210
211  }
212
213  /**
214   * Test that the filter correctly drops rows without a corresponding timestamp
215   */
216  @Test
217  public void testFilterDropping() throws Exception {
218    Filter filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER);
219    List<Cell> accepted = new ArrayList<>();
220    for (Cell val : testVals) {
221      if (filter.filterCell(val) == ReturnCode.INCLUDE) {
222        accepted.add(val);
223      }
224    }
225    assertEquals("check all values accepted from filterCell", 5, accepted.size());
226
227    filter.filterRowCells(accepted);
228    assertEquals("check filterRow(List<KeyValue>) dropped cell without corresponding column entry",
229      4, accepted.size());
230
231    // start do it again with dependent column dropping on
232    filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[1], QUALIFIER, true);
233    accepted.clear();
234    for (KeyValue val : testVals) {
235      if (filter.filterCell(val) == ReturnCode.INCLUDE) {
236        accepted.add(val);
237      }
238    }
239    assertEquals("check the filtering column cells got dropped", 2, accepted.size());
240
241    filter.filterRowCells(accepted);
242    assertEquals("check cell retention", 2, accepted.size());
243  }
244
245  /**
246   * Test for HBASE-8794. Avoid NullPointerException in DependentColumnFilter.toString().
247   */
248  @Test
249  public void testToStringWithNullComparator() {
250    // Test constructor that implicitly sets a null comparator
251    Filter filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER);
252    assertNotNull(filter.toString());
253    assertTrue("check string contains 'null' as compatator is null",
254      filter.toString().contains("null"));
255
256    // Test constructor with explicit null comparator
257    filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, true, CompareOperator.EQUAL, null);
258    assertNotNull(filter.toString());
259    assertTrue("check string contains 'null' as compatator is null",
260      filter.toString().contains("null"));
261  }
262
263  @Test
264  public void testToStringWithNonNullComparator() {
265    Filter filter = new DependentColumnFilter(FAMILIES[0], QUALIFIER, true, CompareOperator.EQUAL,
266      new BinaryComparator(MATCH_VAL));
267    assertNotNull(filter.toString());
268    assertTrue("check string contains comparator value", filter.toString().contains("match"));
269  }
270
271}
